description: The closest intersecting street: Western Avenue | How is the car parked illegally? Other | Details: Several weeks ago, a lot of work was done on North Harvard Street - it was repaved, a bike lane was installed on both sides and the yellow stripes were re-done to reflect the 'new' driving lanes for vehicles. However, the signage was not changed - there were some temporary paper 'No Parking" signs put up but now the same tons of cars are parking IN the bike lanes. On 8/5/09 there were 15 cars parked at 8:00 am; on 8/14/09 there were 27 cars parked at 8 am; on 8/15/09 there were 28 cars parked at 10 am; and today there were already 28 cars parked there at 8:10 am (and this is only on one side of the street - I imagine it is the same on the other side of the street towards Storrow Drive as well). It is VERY difficult driving now as the yellow striping for the driving lanes is not accurate with all these vehicles parked in the bikes lanes. The bikes are still in the driving lanes. It was my understanding that these new areas would be 'no parking zones' but if someone is not enforcing the towing for no parking, the road will never work the way it should. The illegally parked cars should be towed each and every day until people realize that this is no longer 'free parking'. The bike lanes need to be painted to reflect that they are bike lanes. It seems a shame to spend all that $$$ fixing the road and setting up bike lanes to not have them usable due to people who are continuing to park illegally. I realize that this is an ongoing problem, but it needs to be addressed. Once college starts in the fall, the problem will only increase. Thank you, Kathy Moody

I received a call from my neighbor last week telling me my car was being towed from its legal parking spot on Rutland St. two blocks from my home. My license plate is MA 159 FHO. I was very upset to hear this, as I had been careful to park in a no-tow spot as I was leaving town for ten days. I knew I would be returning this Thursday (today), the first street cleaning day on our street. So I looked long and hard before finding the spot on the Monday street cleaning side on Rutland St. It took several calls to the Police tow line and BTD before finding out why my car was towed. I have been making calls to everyone at Boston police and city hall to try to resolve this error, to no avail. The Tow Line suggested I call my local police station's "tow liaison". The officer who answered the phone was rude, and laughed at me saying there was no such thing as a tow liaison. I called the Mayor's constituent line. They said that I should call the local police station back and ask for an auto officer. I did so and the same rude policewoman refused to talk to me and sent me back to the tow line. I called the Mayor's office again and they said there was nothing that could be done, short of appealing to the city clerk. Even then, the operator said, I probably wouldn't get my money back. This is extremely frustrating. My car is currently racking up overnight charges at Bostonian Tow lot in Brighton and I am out of town with no recourse. I don't feel I should come back, have to go to the police station and then to the tow lot and pay hundreds of dollars to release my legally parked South End-permitted car. In the meantime, I have to stay out of town longer than anticipated (until Apr. 9), meaning I'll have to pay even more. I am writing to you as a last recourse, hoping you can arbitrate this in some way on my behalf. Please advise. Sincerely, Stephanie Overby Writing and Editing Services www.stephanieoverby.com 617-852-5542 | Type of vehicle: Car

description: How is the car parked illegally? Other | Please provide details: 2 HR VISITOR PARKING IS NOT BEING ENFORCED AT ALL. The neighborhood is having a problem with people taking advantage of our visitor parking. It appears that the same multiple cars are parking in these spots all day. Our permit parking is from 8AM TO 8PM so it seems that word got out that BTD does not enforce parking in our neighborhood. The biggest problem is mostly from 102 to 108 Hammond St on Both sides of the street. We also have the same problems on other streets in our very small neighborhood. The other 2 hr visitor parking problems is a problem on Greenwich St and Warwick St and right behind good eats restaurant on the cobblestone area which is marked as cabot street but its technically Tremont st. The cars there park for days and its usually a lot of outer state plates that park there every day. At the corner of Hammond and Tremont from about 8p.m. and on each night behind the bus stop there cars park on the sidewalk and the cobblestone area behind the bus stop which is park of the SIDEWALK. Again this is not enforced at all. We had commissioner Tinlin here awhile ago and he acknowledged our parking problems. He had a few cars towed that day and that was the most service that we have gotten for our problems from BTD. We don't want to call him again so we are kind of begging that this area gets enforced. At night it just looks like a bomb hit the area with cars not to mention if we need to use the sidewalks or someone is in a wheelchair.It's a big problem and feel free to call me regarding this matter. Matthew Bouras 617-872-2166. | Type of vehicle: Other | Make: OTHER | Model: 4DR | Color: UNKNOWN
